entry.title: Hat Patong
entry.content:
Address: Kathu, Phuket

Fact

In the Patong subdistrict, between Kamala and Karon, this Beach is a top tourist destination for both Thais and international visitors. The crescent shaped beach with fine sand leads down to a still, clear sea which is perfect for watersports such as Jet-skiing or inflatable ‘banana boats’. The whole stretch of beach is filled with amenities aimed at the tourist, with accommodation, travel agents and tour companies, souvenir shops and chill out spots.

Attraction Type

Beaches & Bay

Important Note

Tourists need to wear facial mask.

entry.title: Phuket Old Town
entry.content:
Address: Mueang Phuket, Phuket

Fact

Comprising of the Thanon Klang, Thanon Dibuk, Thanon Phang Nga, Thanon Yaowarat, Thanon Krabi and Soi Romanee roads, the area is steeped in history and in bygone days was inhabited by settlers from many different nations and ethnic groups, including Chinese, Indians, Europeans and Muslims who came to trade or put down their roots.

These early settlers built terraced homes in a style that later became known as ‘Sino-Portuguese’ architecture. Way back in the reign of King Rama IV, the tin mining industry flourished but these days the mines are preserved as museums and many local buildings have been converted into accommodation, dining spaces, coffee shops and souvenir shops. There is also a large market and walking street which is organized every Sunday between 16.00 and 22.00 hrs. along Thalang Road to give visitors the chance to sample the multicultural charms of the old town.

Attraction Type

Shopping/Historical Houses/Art & Craft Centres/Art Galleries /Village, Community/Local Market/Night Market

Important Note

Tourists need to wear facial mask.

entry.title: Laem Phromthep
entry.content:
Address: Rawai, Mueang Phuket

Fact

This breathtaking sunset viewing spot is located in southern Phuket and famous for its now iconic lighthouse, which casts light beams that can be seen up to 39km out to sea. There is an exhibition housed inside which details the origins and the construction process which led to the lighthouse’s fruition and a display showing the sunrise and sunset times as well as the standardized time for Thailand. Restaurants, coffee shops and souvenir stalls can be found dotted around the cape and there is a paved pathway which leads down to the spot where views of nearby Ko Kaeo Phitsdan and Ya Nui beach await.

Attraction Type

Beaches & Bay

Important Note

Tourists need to wear facial mask.

entry.title: Phuket Big Buddha
entry.content:
Address: Karon

Fact

Phra Phuttha Ming Mongkhon Ek Nakkhiri

Located in front of the Nak Koet Buddhist Park, this Buddha image, in the attitude of subduing Mara, is a stunning piece of contemporary art which measures in at 25.45 meters wide and 45 meters in height. The image is made from reinforced concrete and covered in white and jade ‘Suriyakanta’ marble, imported from neighboring Myanmar and weighing in at a massive 135 tonnes. The image was named by three venerable and highly revered monks: Somdet Prayansangwon, Somdet Prasankarach and Sakolmahasangparinayayok in 2007 and designated as a dharma site which also affords great views over Chalong Bay from the front face of the image and of Kata, Karon and other smaller bays to the rear.

Attraction Type

Landmarks and Memorials/Temple

entry.title: Phuket Thai Hua Museum
entry.content:
Address: Mueang Phuket, Phuket

Fact

Located on Thanon Krabi, in the Talat Nuea subdistrict, the Museum was opened in 1934 and consists of a two-storey Sino-Portuguese building which originally served the purpose of a school offering classes in Hokkien Chinese, the first and only of its kind in the province. The lower floors are currently used for exhibitions related to the lifestyles and history of Hokkien Chinese migrants in Phuket and visitors can find out about their unique customs, beliefs, and traditions here, as well as their relationship with the Phuket locals. For large group visits contacting the museum in advance is recommended

Attraction Type

Museums

entry.title: Rawai Beach
entry.content:
Address: Rawai, Mueang Phuket

Fact

This pier is situated amidst a community of local seafaring people who trawl and fish for their livelihood, and you will find a line of both fishing boats and ferries moored close to the shore most of the time. These local boats are used to ferry Island hopping tourists around the local islands like Ko Lon, Ko He, Ko Bon, Ko Racha and Ko Kaeo Phitsadan for reasonable rental fees. The Beach itself is lined with resorts, beach huts and simple restaurants offering ultra fresh seafood.

Attraction Type

Beaches & Bay

Important Note

Tourists need to wear facial mask.

entry.title: Chinpracha House Museum (Ban Chinpracha)
entry.content:
Address: Mueang Phuket, Phuket

Fact

This property stands on Thanon Krabi in the Talat Nuea subdistrict and was built towards the end of King Rama IV’s reign. It is widely believed to be the first example of Sino-Portuguese architecture in the whole of the Phuket province. The distinguishing features of the two-storey house are the ornate front door, decorated with golden Chinese characters and distinctive colored glass windowpanes. There is a small pond located in the airy, open central courtyard area, imported Italian tiles on the floor, an ornate wooden staircase and many household fixtures and decorations from China. In fact, almost everything in the house is imported, a fact made possible Phuket was once a trading route for ships on their way between Penang, Malaysia and Europe.

Attraction Type

Museums
